metadata.title: USN-6345-1 -- SoX vulnerability
metadata.description: It was discovered that SoX incorrectly handled certain inputs. If a user or an automated system were tricked into opening a specially crafted input file, an attacker could possibly use this issue to cause a denial of service.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-6345-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  libsox-fmt-mp3 - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-fmt-pulse - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-fmt-ao - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 sox - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox2 - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-fmt-base - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-fmt-all - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-dev - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-fmt-alsa - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 libsox-fmt-oss - 14.4.1-5+deb8u4ubuntu0.1+esm3 Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
